article: A man who loved to hunt bought two setters that he trained to be fine bird dogs. He kept them in a large, fenced pen in his _ . One morning he _ a little bulldog running down the path behind his home. It saw the two dogs and squeezed under the fence. The man thought he should perhaps lock up the setters so they wouldn't hurt the little dog, but changed his mind. Maybe they would teach that bulldog a lesson he thought. As he _ , fur began to fly, and all of it was bulldog fur. The bulldog soon had enough and got away . To the man' s _ , the incident was repeated the following day with the _ results. The man left early the next morning _ a business trip and returned after several weeks. He asked his wife what finally happened to the bulldog. "You won't _ it, "she replied. "At the same time every day that little dog came to the backyard and fought with our setters. He never _ a day! Now when our setters hear him barking down the _ , they ran down into the basement. Then the little bulldog walks around our backyard as if he owned it. " How do you manage those problems you come across daily? Dale Carnegie made this observation: "Most of the important things in the world have been. _ by people who have kept on trying _ there seemed to be no hope at all. " In the end, it's the _ bulldog that will own the backyard.
